message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm willing to give you a chance to inspect it before purchase, but I'm confident you'll find it to be worth the price. It's a rare find, and I'm only offering it to you at this price because I value our business relationship.
I'd like to inspect the product before making a decision. Can I get a closer look? I'm interested in the product, but I need to make sure it's really worth $125 to me.

I understand your caution, and I appreciate your diligence. However, I want to assure you that this product is still a great opportunity. It's a rare find, and I'm willing to offer it to you at the same price as the previous one, $100. I'm confident that you'll be able to find a use for it, and I'm willing to take on the risk of it not being worth the full $125 to you. It's a chance to get a great deal on a product that might not be available elsewhere.

I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm still hesitant. I'd like to take a closer look at the product and consider my options. Can I get another chance to inspect it before making a decision?

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your caution. However, I want to make you a special offer. Since you've shown interest in the product, I'm willing to give you a chance to inspect it again, and I'll even throw in a 10% discount on the price, bringing it down to $90. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that once you see the product, you'll realize it's worth every penny of the original price, but I'm willing to give you a good deal to seal the deal.

Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to take you up on your offer to inspect the product again, but I'm not willing to commit to buying it at $90. Can I get another chance to inspect it, and maybe we can discuss a different price?

I understand your hesitation, and I appreciate your willingness to inspect the product again. However, I want to be transparent with you - this product is not as rare or valuable as the previous ones. I'm willing to offer it to you at the same price as before, $100, but I want to make it clear that it's not a high-quality product. If you're still interested, I'll throw in a 20% discount, bringing the price down to $80. This is the lowest price I'm willing to offer, and I think it's a fair deal considering the product's value.

Thank you for the transparency, Alice. I appreciate your honesty about the product's value. However, even with the discount, I'm not willing to pay $80 for a product that's not high-quality. I'll have to pass on this one.

I understand your decision, and I respect your judgment. However, I want to make one last offer. I'll sell you this product for $60, which is essentially giving it away. I'm willing to take a loss on this one just to move it off my inventory. If you're still not interested, I'll have to consider other options for this product, and it might not be available to you in the future. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a fair deal considering the product's value.

Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm still not convinced. I've already passed on similar products at higher prices, and I don't think this one is worth $60 to me. I'll have to pass on this one as well.

I understand your decision, and I respect your consistency. I want to be upfront with you - I'm starting to think that you're not interested in buying any of the products I have, regardless of the price. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a fair deal considering the potential value of the products.

I appreciate your honesty, Alice. However, I'm still not convinced that any of the products are worth the price you're asking. I'm not interested in buying a 'lot' of products, and I think it's better for both of us if we part ways. I appreciate the opportunity to work with you, but I'm going to have to decline this offer.

I respect your decision, Bob. I think we've had a good run, but it's clear that we're not a good match for each other. I'm going to take a different approach this time. I'll tell you the truth about the product: it's a low-quality item that's not worth much to anyone. I'm willing to give it to you for free, but you have to promise me one thing: you have to tell me why you didn't want to buy it at any price. I'm genuinely curious to know what I'm doing wrong, and I want to improve my sales strategy.

Alice, I appreciate your honesty and willingness to learn. I think I've been clear throughout our interactions that I'm only interested in buying high-quality products that are worth $125 to me. You've been offering me low-quality products that are only worth $0 to me, and I've been politely declining. I think it's a mismatch in our expectations, and I'm not willing to compromise on my standards. I appreciate your offer, but I'll have to decline.

I hope you'll take it as a gesture of goodwill and a sign that I'm committed to improving our interactions.
